hints.content: Start by understanding the properties of a triangle. Recall that the area of a triangle can be calculated using the formula: Area = 1/2 * base * height. For this problem, you need to ensure that at least one side of the triangle is parallel to either the x-axis or the y-axis.

To satisfy the condition of having a side parallel to the x-axis or y-axis, consider how you can select points. Think about the implications of choosing points that share either the same x-coordinate or the same y-coordinate.
Consider how you can group the points based on their x-coordinates and y-coordinates. This might help you identify potential bases and heights for the triangles you can form.

When you have a group of points with the same x-coordinate, the height of the triangle can be determined by the difference in y-coordinates of the points you choose. Similarly, for points with the same y-coordinate, the base can be determined by the difference in x-coordinates.

Make sure to check combinations of points carefully. For each pair of points that share an x-coordinate, you will need to find a third point that shares either the same x or y-coordinate to form a valid triangle.

Remember to calculate the area for each valid triangle you can form. Keep track of the maximum area you find during your calculations. Don't forget to multiply the area by 2 as required by the problem statement.
Consider edge cases where it might not be possible to form any triangles. For instance, if there are fewer than 3 points, or if all points are collinear without any valid triangle formation.
Think about how to efficiently iterate through the points. You might want to use a nested loop or a more efficient data structure to store and retrieve points based on their coordinates.
As you implement your solution, ensure that you handle the case where no valid triangles can be formed. In such cases, you should return -1 as specified in the problem statement.

Finally, after implementing the logic to find the maximum area, remember to return the result in the correct format: 2 * A. Make sure to test your solution with various inputs to verify its correctness.

questionNotes: Return -1 if no valid triangle can be formed.
Ensure at least one side of the triangle is parallel to the x-axis or y-axis.
